COMMAND.name: show route-mac
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the show route-mac privileged EXEC command to display the route-mac of the device.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use the command to display the route-mac of the device.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is an example of show route-mac: Switch# show route-mac Route MAC is: 001e.080a.662f

COMMAND.name: show system-mac
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the show system-mac privileged EXEC command to display the system-mac of the device.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use the command to display the system-mac of the device.

COMMAND.name: show interface
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "null" == ${part} ]; then cdbctl show/cdb/l2/show_interface/null0 else cdbctl update/cdb/sys/update_if_stats/${iface_name} usleep 100000 cdbctl show/cdb/l2/show_interface/${iface_name} fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to display the configurations and statistics on all interfaces or an interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to display the configurations and statistics on the interface eth-0-1. Switch# show interface eth-0-1 Interface eth-0-1 Interface current state: DOWN Hardware is Port, address is 001e.0809.78a3 Bandwidth 1000000 kbits Index 1 , Metric 1 Speed - auto , Duplex - auto , Media type is 1000BASE_T Link speed type is autonegotiation, Link duplex type is autonegotiation Admin input flow-control is off, output flow-control is off Oper input flow-control is off, output flow-control is off The Maximum Frame Size is 1632 bytes 5 minute input rate 0 bits/sec, 0 packets/sec 5 minute output rate 0 bits/sec, 0 packets/sec 0 packets input, 0 bytes Received 0 unicast, 0 broadcast, 0 multicast 0 runts, 0 giants, 0 input errors, 0 CRC 0 frame, 0 overrun, 0 pause input 0 packets output, 0 bytes Transmitted 0 unicast, 0 broadcast, 0 multicast 0 underruns, 0 output errors, 0 pause output

COMMAND.name: show interface status
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to display the brief information on all Ethernet and link aggregation interfaces.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command will display interface's brief information.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to display the brief information on all Ethernet and LAG interfaces: Switch# show interface status Name Status Duplex Speed Mode Type Description ----------+-----------+--------+--------+-------+------------+---------------- eth-0-1 up a-full a-1000 access 1000BASE_T eth-0-2 down auto auto access 1000BASE_T eth-0-3 down auto auto access 1000BASE_T eth-0-4 down auto auto access 1000BASE_T eth-0-5 down auto auto access 1000BASE_T eth-0-6 down auto auto access 1000BASE_T eth-0-7 down auto auto access 1000BASE_T eth-0-8 down auto auto access 1000BASE_T eth-0-9 down auto auto access 1000BASE_T eth-0-10 down auto auto access 1000BASE_T

COMMAND.name: show interface description
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to display the description information on all interfaces.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command will interface's description information.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to display the description information on all interfaces: Name Status Description ----------+-----------+--------------------------------------------------------- eth-0-1 admin down ABCDEABCDE eth-0-2 admin down ABCDEABCDEABCDEABCDEABCDEABCDEABCDEABCDEABCDEABCDEABCDEAB CDE1234 eth-0-3 admin down eth-0-4 admin down eth-0-5 admin down eth-0-6 admin down eth-0-7 admin down eth-0-8 admin down ......

COMMAND.name: show interface bandwidth-in-use
COMMAND.help: Show bandwidth usage and log-threshold configuration of the interfaces
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "input" == ${mode} ]; then cdbctl show/cdb/sys/show_bandwidth_usage/${iface_name}/input elif [ "output" == ${mode} ]; then cdbctl show/cdb/sys/show_bandwidth_usage/${iface_name}/output else cdbctl show/cdb/sys/show_bandwidth_usage/${iface_name} fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to display the bandwidth usage information of the interfaces which configured log-threshold.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command will display the bandwidth usage information of the interfaces which configured log-threshold.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to display the bandwidth usage information of the interfaces: Switch# show interface bandwidth-in-use eth-0-1/1 Name Direction Speed Load-interval Threshold ResumeRate Usage ----------+----------+--------+-------------+----------+----------+------ eth-0-1/1 input 40Gb/s 150s 90% 70% 60% eth-0-1/1 output 40Gb/s 150s 80% 60% 85%

COMMAND.name: show loopback
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to display the loopback information on all interfaces.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command will display interface's loopback information.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: DUT2# show loopback Interface Type -------------------- eth-0-2 internal --------------------

COMMAND.name: clear counters
COMMAND.help: Clear counters on one or all interfaces
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to clear the counters on the physical interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The clear counters command clears all current interface counters from the interface unless you specify optional arguments that clear only a specific interface type from a specific interface number.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE:
This example shows how to clear the counters on all interfaces: Switch# clear counters
This example shows how to clear the counters on the interface eth-0-1: Switch# clear counters eth-0-1
This example shows how to clear the counters on the agg1: Switch# clear counters agg1

COMMAND.name: clear carrier blink-down
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to clear carrier blink-down history records.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to clear carrier blink-down history records.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to clear carrier blink-down history records: Switch# clear carrier blink-down

COMMAND.name: show carrier blink-down
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show carrier blink-down history records.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to show carrier blink-down history records.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to show carrier blink-down history records: Switch# show carrier blink-down Index Interface Time ------+------------------+------------------------- 1 eth-0-53 2017-07-17 10:15:16 2 eth-0-54 2017-07-17 13:25:54

COMMAND.name: interface range

PARAM.name: ifacelist
PARAM.help: Interfaces joined by '-' or ',', e.g: eth-0-1 - 8 or eth-0-1, eth-0-2

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to operate a list of interfaces, the interface include physical port, vlan interface, linkagg interface and loopback interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to operate a list of interfaces, the interface include physical port, vlan interface, linkagg interface and loopback interface.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to operate a list of physical interface: Switch(config)# interface range eth-0-1 – 24 Switch(config-if-range)# shutdown

COMMAND.name: interface
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to create and enter interface mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The interface name can be either a port name (i.e. eth-0-1) or link-agg name (i.e. agg1) or vlan name (i.e. vlan2).
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE:
This example shows how to enter the interface mode for eth-0-1: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1
This example shows how to enter the interface mode for agg1: Switch(config)# interface agg1
This example shows how to enter the interface mode for vlan2: Switch(config)# interface vlan2

COMMAND.name: no interface
COMMAND.ACTION: cdbctl delete/cdb/interface/${iface_name} if [ "$?" != "0" ] ; then exit 1 else usleep 300000 fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to delete interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The interface name can be either a port name (i.e. eth-0-1) or vlan name (i.e. vlan2).
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE:
This example shows how to delete the interface eth-0-1: Switch(config)# no interface eth-0-1
This example shows how to enter the interface vlan2: Switch(config)# no interface vlan2

COMMAND.name: interface null
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to operate a list of interfaces, the interface include physical port, vlan interface, linkagg interface and loopback interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to operate a list of interfaces, the interface include physical port, vlan interface, linkagg interface and loopback interface.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to operate a list of physical interface: Switch(config)# interface null 0

COMMAND.name: do
COMMAND.help: To run exec commands in config mode

COMMAND.name: no
COMMAND.help: Negate a command or set its defaults

COMMAND.name: shutdown
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the shutdown interface configuration command to admin down an interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use the command to shutdown a port.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows how to shutdown a port: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# shutdown

COMMAND.name: no shutdown
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to admin up an interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows how to admin up a port: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no shutdown

COMMAND.name: description
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the description on the interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to set the description on the interface.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example sets the description on the interface: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# description Ethernet

COMMAND.name: no description
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To remove the description on the interface, use this command.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to remove the description on the interface,
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example sets the description on the interface: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no description

COMMAND.name: speed
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the speed interface configuration command to specify the speed of a 10/100 Mb/s or 10/100/1000 Mb/s port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The command is used to set the speed on port.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set the speed on a port to 1000 Mb/s: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# speed 1000

COMMAND.name: no speed
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the no of this command to return the port to its default speed value.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use the no of this command to return the port to its default speed value.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to return the speed on a port to default value: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no speed

COMMAND.name: duplex
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the duplex interface configuration command to specify the duplex mode of operation for a port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use the command to set the duplex mode on a port.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE:
This example shows how to set the duplex mode to auto: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# duplex auto
This example shows how to set the duplex mode to full: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# duplex full

COMMAND.name: no duplex
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to return the port to its default value.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to return the port to its default value.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to return the duplex mode to default: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no duplex

COMMAND.name: unidirectional
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the command to set unidirectional function for a port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use the command to set unidirectional function for a port.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to enable unidirectional function: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# unidirectional enable

COMMAND.name: fec
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the command to set fec function for a port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use the command to set fec function for a port.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to enable fec function: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# fec enable

COMMAND.name: no fec
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the command to set fec function for a port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use the command to set fec function for a port.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to disable fec function: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no fec

COMMAND.name: bandwidth
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the bandwidth of the port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to set the bandwidth of the port.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set the bandwidth of the port: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# bandwidth 1000

COMMAND.name: no bandwidth
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To return the bandwidth to default value, use this command.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to set the bandwidth to default value.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to return the bandwidth to default value: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no bandwidth

COMMAND.name: jumboframe
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to enable jumbo frame.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Jumboframe is disabled by default. The max frame which can be transmitted is 1632 bytes. When enable jumboframe, the max frame can be 9600 bytes.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to enable the jumboframe: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# jumboframe enable

COMMAND.name: no jumboframe
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To disable jumbo frame, use this command.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to disable jumbo frame.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to disable the jumboframe: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no jumboframe enable

COMMAND.name: mtu
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure the maximum transmit unit for this interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is only allowed to be used in layer3 interface.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure MTU 1600 for VLAN interface 1: Switch(config)# interface vlan1 Switch(config-if-vlan1)# mtu 1600

COMMAND.name: no mtu
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to return the maximum transmit unit for this interface to its default value.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is only allowed to be used in layer3 interface.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure MTU to default value for VLAN interface 1: Switch(config)# interface vlan1 Switch(config-if-vlan1)# no mtu

COMMAND.name: static-channel-group
COMMAND.help: Add interface to static channel group

PARAM.name: priority
PARAM.help: Priority for agg member.the lower of the priority value, the higher of the rank, default is 0

COMMAND.ACTION:
cdbctl create/cdb/interface/${iface}/lag/${gid}/mode/static/${priority_num}
if [ "$?" != "0" ] ; then exit 1 else usleep 500000 fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to assign a port to a static channel group.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to assign a port to a static channel group.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to assign a port to a static channel group 1: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# static-channel-group 1

COMMAND.name: no static-channel-group
COMMAND.help: Delete interface from static channel group
COMMAND.ACTION: usleep 300000 cdbctl delete/cdb/interface/${iface}/lag/static if [ "$?" != "0" ] ; then exit 1 else usleep 200000 fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to remove a port from a static channel group.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to remove a port from a static channel group.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to remove a port from a static channel group 1: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no static-channel-group

COMMAND.name: max-active-number
COMMAND.help: The active max number for active-backup mode

PARAM.name: NUM
PARAM.help: The number of active-max-number, default is 16

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the active max number.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to set the active max number.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set the active max number: Switch(config)# interface agg1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# active-max-number 8

COMMAND.name: no max-active-number
COMMAND.help: The active max number for active-backup mode
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to unset the active max number.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to unset the active max number.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to unset the active max number: Switch(config)# interface agg1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no active-max-number

COMMAND.name: channel-group
COMMAND.help: Add interface to dynamic channel group

PARAM.name: active
PARAM.help: Enable initiation of LACP negotiation on a port

PARAM.name: passive
PARAM.help: Disable initiation of LACP negotiation on a port

COMMAND.ACTION: cdbctl create/cdb/interface/${iface}/lag/${gid}/mode/${mode_value} if [ "$?" != "0" ] ; then exit 1 else usleep 500000 fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to assign a port to a channel group.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to assign a port to a channel group.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to assign a port to a channel group 1: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# channel-group 1 mode active

COMMAND.name: no channel-group
COMMAND.help: Delete interface from dynamic channel group
COMMAND.ACTION: cdbctl delete/cdb/interface/${iface}/lag/dynamic if [ "$?" != "0" ] ; then exit 1 else usleep 200000 fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to remove a port from a channel group.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to remove a port from a channel group.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to remove a port from an channel group 1: Switch(config-if)# no channel-group

COMMAND.name: mac learning
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "enable" == ${action} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/brgif/mac_learning_en/1 else cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/brgif/mac_learning_en/0 fi;
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the configuration command set mac_learning enable or disable.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set mac-learning enable or disable. Switch(config-if-eth-0-1) mac learning enable Switch(config-if-eth-0-1) mac learning disable

COMMAND.name: loopback
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "internal" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/phy_loopback_mode/internal elif [ "external" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/phy_loopback_mode/external fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the configuration command set loopback of interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set loopback of interface. Switch(config-if-eth-0-1) loopback internal Switch(config-if-eth-0-1) loopback external

COMMAND.name: no loopback
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the configuration command unset loopback of interface .
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to unset loopback of port. Switch(config-if-eth-0-1) no loopback

COMMAND.name: flow-statistics include-interframe
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the configuration command set interface flow-statistics if include packet's interframe length or not.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to interface flow-statistics doesn't include packet's interframe length or not. Switch(config-if-eth-0-1) flow-statistics include-interframe disable

COMMAND.name: media-type
COMMAND.help: Set media type of combo port
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "sfp" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/media/sfp elif [ "rj45" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/media/rj45 else cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/media/auto fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the configuration command set media type of combo port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set media type of combo port. Switch(config-if-eth-0-1) media-type auto Switch(config-if-eth-0-1) media-type rj45 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1) media-type sfp

COMMAND.name: no media-type
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the configuration command unset media type of combo port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to unset media type of combo port. Switch(config-if-eth-0-1) no media-type

COMMAND.name: log-threshold
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the configuration command to enable log-threshold on an interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to enable log-threshold on an interface.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to enable log-threshold on an interface: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1/1)# log-threshold input-rate 80 resume-rate 60

COMMAND.name: no log-threshold
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "input-rate" == ${mode} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/sys/port_stats_rate/${iface}/input_rate_threshold/0/input_rate_resume/0 elif [ "output-rate" == ${mode} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/sys/port_stats_rate/${iface}/output_rate_threshold/0/output_rate_resume/0 elif [ "output-discard" == ${mode} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/sys/port_stats_rate/${iface}/output_discard_threshold/0/output_discard_interval/0 fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the configuration command to disable log-threshold on an interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to disable log-threshold on an interface.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to disable log-threshold on an interface: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1/1)# no log-threshold input-rate

COMMAND.name: load-interval
COMMAND.help: Specify interval for speed calculation of an interface
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the configuration command to set load interval on an interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to set load interval on an interface.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set load interval on an interface: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1/1)# load-interval 90

COMMAND.name: no load-interval
COMMAND.help: Specify interval for speed calculation of an interface
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the configuration command to set default load interval on an interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to set default load interval on an interface.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default load interval on an interface: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1/1)# no load-interval

COMMAND.name: poe mode
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "af" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/poe/mode/af elif [ "at" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/poe/mode/at else cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/poe/mode/poh fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the configuration command set power mode of poe port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set power mode of poe port. Switch(config-if-eth-0-1) poe mode af Switch(config-if-eth-0-1) poe mode at Switch(config-if-eth-0-1) poe mode poh

COMMAND.name: poe priority
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "critical" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/poe/priority/1 elif [ "high" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/poe/priority/2 else cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/poe/priority/3 fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the configuration command set poe priority of port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set poe priority of port. Switch(config-if-eth-0-1) poe priority critical Switch(config-if-eth-0-1) poe priority high Switch(config-if-eth-0-1) poe priority low

COMMAND.name: exit
COMMAND.help: End current mode and down to previous mode

COMMAND.name: quit
COMMAND.help: Exit current mode and down to previous mode

COMMAND.name: do
COMMAND.help: To run exec commands in config mode
